meanings.definition: To drink something quickly and in large gulps.
meanings.sent1: He chugged his juice before heading to school.
meanings.sent2: She chugged her water after a long run.
meanings.sent3: The little boy chugged his milk so fast, he got a milk mustache!
meanings.sent4: Time chugged along like a slow train, never stopping.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall chugged down the rocks, refreshing everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To move with a steady, rhythmic motion.
meanings.sent1: The old train chugged slowly up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The boat chugged through the calm waters of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot chugged around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent4: The steam engine chugged along the tracks, puffing out white smoke.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker chugged up the mountain, one step at a time.

meanings.definition: To operate an engine noisily or laboriously.
meanings.sent1: The tractor chugged across the field, plowing the soil.
meanings.sent2: The old car chugged along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent3: The lawnmower chugged to life after many attempts.
meanings.sent4: The factory chugged all night, producing goods for the market.
meanings.sent5: The steamboat chugged down the river, its paddlewheel turning.
